A first order language <math>\mathfrak{L}</math> is an infinite collection of distinct symbols, no one of which is properly contained in another, separated into the following categories
* Parenthesis: (, )
* Connectives: <math>\lor, \neg</math>
* Quantifier: <math>\forall</math>
* Variables: for each positive integer <math>n: v_1, v_2, \ldots, v_n, \ldots</math> We denote the set of variables symbols as Vars
* Equality symbol: =
* Constant symbols: Some set of zero or more symbols
* Function symbols: For each positive integer <math>n</math>, some set of zero or more <math>n</math>-ary function symbols
* Relation symbols: For each positive integer <math>n</math>, some set of zero or more <math>n</math>-ary relation symbols
